lead_paragraph: Ron "Stray Dog" Hall lives in Southern Missouri where he owns and operates the At Ease RV Park.  After seven years of living with four small dogs as his only companions, he is adjusting to life with his wife, Alicia, who is newly arrived from Mexico. Anchored by his small dogs and big bikes, Stray Dog seeks to strike a balance between his commitment to his family, neighbors, biker brotherhood and fellow veterans. As part of the legacy of fighting in the Vietnam War, he wrestles with the everlasting puzzle of conscience, remorse and forgiveness. Alicia joins him on his annual cross-country ride with thousands of bikers to the Vietnam Memorial in Washington DC, trying to decipher biker culture. And back home, Stray Dog deals with economic pressures and adjusts to the arrival of Alicia's twin sons from Mexico.
